content.raw:
I agree with Nate here. If the software is designed to be able to be installed side-by-side the different major versions, then we will need different files names.

The same happen with the -dev files. Normally, it is possible to have two libraries installed at the same time, but only one -dev is allowed in the system. Ogre is a good example of this, with two different -dev files for 1.8 and 1.9.
content.html:
I agree with Nate here. If the software is designed to be able to be installed side-by-side the different major versions, then we will need different files names.

The same happen with the -dev files. Normally, it is possible to have two libraries installed at the same time, but only one -dev is allowed in the system. Ogre is a good example of this, with two different -dev files for 1.8 and 1.9.

content.raw: Ideally very infrequently. I bumped the major version number of ignition-math in this case because ABI changed (private classes added).
content.html: Ideally very infrequently. I bumped the major version number of ignition-math in this case because ABI changed (private classes added).

content.raw:
QT is one example. You can install both qt4 and qt5 development side-by-side. 

ROS is another example (a string name is used instead of a number)

Requires `libignition-math2-dev`
update.title: Convert to use ignition-math

content.raw: This is different that any of our other packages. I believe we append the major version to debian package names and homebrew formulae, but the pkg-config and cmake config files always have the same name (ie. `sdformat.pc` or `gazebo.pc`). @\_jrivero_ your thoughts?
content.html: This is different that any of our other packages. I believe we append the major version to debian package names and homebrew formulae, but the pkg-config and cmake config files always have the same name (ie. sdformat.pc or gazebo.pc). @_jrivero_ your thoughts?

content.raw: I feel like I'm taking crazy pills.
content.html: I feel like I'm taking crazy pills.

content.raw:
Strangely, I get different values for `typeid(ignition::math::Pose3d).hash_code()` in Param.cc and SDF_TEST.cc (see print statements added in a33755d6cdd4):
~~~
Param.cc: 1062a8650
SDF_TEST: 1061d11d0
~~~
Param.cc compiles to the libsdformat shared library, while SDF_TEST.cc compiles to an executable. Are the hash_codes different between shared libraries?
content.html:
Strangely, I get different values for typeid(ignition::math::Pose3d).hash_code() in Param.cc and SDF_TEST.cc (see print statements added in a33755d6cdd4):

Param.cc: 1062a8650
SDF_TEST: 1061d11d0

Param.cc compiles to the libsdformat shared library, while SDF_TEST.cc compiles to an executable. Are the hash_codes different between shared libraries?

content.raw:
I switched to `EXPECT_EQ(a, b)` instead of `EXPECT_TRUE(a == b)` in 2270f24, which gives a more informative error message for the homebrew test failure:
~~~
/Users/jenkins/workspace/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/sdformat3/src/SDF_TEST.cc:137
Value of: typeid(ignition::math::Pose3d)
  Actual: 16-byte object <70-E4 96-7E FF-7F 00-00 F0-CF D8-00 01-00 00-00>
Expected: poseParam->GetType()
Which is: 16-byte object <70-E4 96-7E FF-7F 00-00 C0-BF E9-00 01-00 00-00>
~~~
content.html:
I switched to EXPECT_EQ(a, b) instead of EXPECT_TRUE(a == b) in 2270f24, which gives a more informative error message for the homebrew test failure:

/Users/jenkins/workspace/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/sdformat3/src/SDF_TEST.cc:137
Value of: typeid(ignition::math::Pose3d)
  Actual: 16-byte object <70-E4 96-7E FF-7F 00-00 F0-CF D8-00 01-00 00-00>
Expected: poseParam->GetType()
Which is: 16-byte object <70-E4 96-7E FF-7F 00-00 C0-BF E9-00 01-00 00-00>

content.raw:
* [jenkins uptopic is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-utopic-amd64/19)
* [jenkins homebrew is unstable](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/27/) with a [failing test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/27/testReport/%28root%29/SDFUpdate/UpdateElement/)
~~~
27: [ RUN      ] SDFUpdate.UpdateElement
27: Warning [parser.cc:396] Converting a deprecated SDF source[data-string].
27: /Users/jenkins/workspace/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/sdformat3/src/SDF_TEST.cc:137: Failure
27: Value of: poseParam->GetType() == typeid(ignition::math::Pose3d)
27:   Actual: false
27: Expected: true
27: [  FAILED  ] SDFUpdate.UpdateElement (43 ms)
~~~
* [jenkins docker trusty is broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker/21/) due to a [release-tools issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/issue/42/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker-not)

* [jenkins windows is broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-windows7-amd64/26/)
